articles.title: CoinDesk 20 Performance Update: Solana (SOL) Gains 3.1% as Index Trades Flat
articles.description: Ethereum (ETH) joined Solana (SOL) as a top performer, rising 0.9% over the weekend.

articles.title: ‘Big orange’: Michael Saylor’s Strategy buys another 13,627 bitcoin for $1.25 billion following MSCI indexing decision
articles.description: Strategy's holdings account for more than 3% of the total 21 million bitcoin supply — worth around $62 billion.

articles.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
articles.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

articles.title: Seventy economists urge EU to ‘let the public interest prevail’ on digital euro
articles.description: Economists urge EU lawmakers to back a public digital euro, warning that private stablecoins and foreign payment companies threaten Europe’s monetary sovereignty.

articles.title: Vitalik Buterin outlines conditions for a self-sustaining, quantum-safe Ethereum
articles.description: Buterin outlined a framework for making Ethereum’s base layer ossifiable, emphasizing quantum resistance and protocol independence.

articles.title: UK lawmakers push to ban crypto political donations over foreign interference fears
articles.description: They argue that cryptocurrency's opacity and traceability issues make it a threat to democratic integrity, citing an intelligence report election interference.

articles.title: Veteran trader Peter Brandt hints at silver-like bull run in Monero
articles.description: Monero set fresh records earlier Monday, driven by renewed interest in privacy and upcoming protocol upgrades.

articles.title: ​​Top UK Labour lawmakers push to ban political donations made in crypto
articles.description: The chairs of seven UK government committees have asked for a ban on crypto donations to be added to an elections bill set to be introduced soon.

articles.title: Monero Sets New Record Price as Privacy Trade Re-Emerges
articles.description: Monero’s push to a record high follows renewed interest in privacy-focused coins, even as uneven liquidity complicates price signals.

articles.title: JPMorgan downplays stablecoin threat as local bankers warn of $6.6 trillion risk
articles.description: The ABA sent a letter to the U.S. Senate, saying stablecoins that offer yields will affect its banking members ability to grant loans, but JPMorgan disagrees.

articles.title: Ethereum treasury company BitMine crosses 1 million staked ETH milestone
articles.description: The latest staking move highlights the growing scale of corporate Ethereum treasuries as firms look to generate yield on idle crypto holdings.

articles.description: Researchers built autonomous robots the size of salt grains—with onboard computers, sensors, and motors that think and swim independently for months.

articles.title: New York Lawmakers Target Prediction Markets as NHL's Rangers Ink Polymarket Deal
articles.description: A New York assemblyman reintroduced a bill that would restrict prediction markets, barring bets on individual sports matches, war, and more.

articles.title: Florida Lawmakers Renew Push to Launch State Bitcoin Reserve
articles.description: Florida lawmakers introduced another bill for the creation of a strategic Bitcoin reserve, less than a year after two attempts were shelved.
